place.name: BRIDELL
place.gazetteerText: BRIDELL, a parish in the district of Cardigan and county of Pembroke; near the river Teifi and the Carmarthen and Cardigan railway, 3 miles S by E of Cardigan. Post Town, Cardigan. Acres, 2,179. Real property, £1,659. Pop., 326. Houses, 73. The property is divided among a few. The living is a rectory in the diocese of St. David's. Value, £110. Patron, the Freeholders of the parish. The church is ancient, in tolerable condition; and a St. Catherine's cross is in the churchyard. There is a dissenting chapel. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
